description.narrative:
Partnership for Economics Education and Research (PEER) har ansökt hos Sida om finansiering om 20 miljoner SEK för att genomföra ”ISET Policy Institute: promoting Georgia's Development Through Independent Policy Analysis, Training and Civil Society Engagement" i Georgien under perioden 2014–2019.
Stödet är ämnat att stärka Georgiens unga demokrati och bidra till högre kvalitet och bättre balans i beslutsfattandet på finanspolitikens kärnområden genom 1) att erbjuda analyser av politiska program, kunskap och idéer för att främja reformer på prioriterade områden 2) att bygga upp den georgiska regeringens kapacitet att utforma och implementera politik i linje med dess 2020-strategi och samt associeringsavtalet med EU 3) att utbilda allmänheten och arbeta med näringslivet och civilsamhället för att understödja den process där det skapas politiska idéer och debatt. Partnership for Economics Education and Research (PEER) genom ISET Policy Institute kommer att genomföra insatsen.
Insatsens totala budget är 24 473 000 SEK. Sida bidrar med 20 miljoner SEK (2 728 410 USD) och 4 473 000 SEK (587 690 USD) finansieras av andra givare. - Partnership for Economics Education and Research (PEER) has applied to Sida for funding of 20 million SEK to carry out the "ISET Policy Institute: promoting Georgia's Development Through Independent Policy Analysis, Training and Civil Society Engagement" in Georgia during the period 2014-2019.
The intervention aims strengthening Georgia's fledging democracy and contributing to the quality and balance of decision-making in key areas of economic policy by 1) providing policy analysis, knowledge and ideas to promote reforms in priority areas 2) developing the capacity within the government of Georgia to design and implement policies consistent with its 2020 strategy and AA/DCFTA 3) educating the public and work with business and civil society groups to facilitate process of policy formulation and debate.
Partnership for Economics Education and Research (PEER ) will implement the intervention through ISET Policy Institute.
The intervention’s total budget is 24 473 000 SEK, out of which the other donors funding is 4 473 000 SEK ( 587 690 USD) and the remaining 20 million SEK (2 728 410 USD) is contributed by Sida.

Sida has supported PEER/ISET MA since 2006 and PEER/ISET-PI since its inception 2011 with good results.
Partnership for Economics Education and Research (PEER) ISET PI has applied to Sida for funding of 20 million SEK to carry out the "ISET Policy Institute: promoting Georgia's Development Through Independent Policy Analysis, Training and Civil Society Engagement"" in Georgia during the period 2014-2019.
The intervention aims strengthening Georgia's fledging democracy and contributing to the quality and balance of decision-making in key areas of economic policy by 1) providing policy analysis, knowledge and ideas to promote reforms in priority areas 2) developing the capacity within the government of Georgia to design and implement policies consistent with its 2020 strategy and the AA/DCFTA 3) educating the public and work with business and civil society groups to facilitate process of policy formulation and debate.
The intervention’s total budget is 24 473 000 SEK, out of which the other donors funding is 4 473 000 SEK ( 587 690 USD) and the remaining 20 million SEK (2 728 410 USD) is contributed by the Embassy of Sweden in Tbilisi.

The development intervention's overall aim is strengthening Georgia’s fledgling democracy and contributing to the quality and balance of decision-making in key areas of economic policy: macroeconomic and financial stability; private sector development and social inclusion; development of Georgia’s energy resources and protection of the environment; promotion of agricultural development and structural change (away from agriculture) through sound labor market, health and education policies.

tag.narrative: 8.3 - Främja utvecklingsinriktad politik som stöder produktiv verksamhet, skapande av anständiga arbetstillfällen, företagande, kreativitet och innovation samt uppmuntra att mikroföretag liksom små och medelstora företag växer och blir en del av den formella ekonomin, bland annat genom tillgång till finansiella tjänster.

8.3 - Promote development-oriented policies that support productive activities, decent job creation, entrepreneurship, creativity and innovation, and encourage the formalization and growth of micro-, small- and medium-sized enterprises, including through access to financial services.

description.narrative: The reporting year 2019-2020 was very successful for ISET-PI from several perspectives: its positioning as a prime economic think tank was strengthened; its policy impact across various areas was substantial; capacity building projects were successfully pursued; and the organization’s visibility substantially increased, especially as a result of the relevance of the policy analysis and advice provided during the COVID-19 pandemic. While ISET continued to produce its key policy products (economic indices, blogs, policy papers,and project reports) and pursued its key policy activities (impact assessments, training, and public outreach), it also substantially increased its activities of a think tank nature. It acted on most of the nine recommendations made by the Sida evaluation of 2018 in order to strengthen the standing,effectiveness and efficiency of the institution. ISET PI took measures towards positioning ISET-PI aseconomic policy think tank; towards cross-fertilization between the academic and policy arms of theinstitution; towards strengthening the institutional capacity of ISET-PI’s management and support structures; towards acting as one team, focusing on strategic communication, including in the Georgian language, and developing new models. The COVID-19 pandemic broadened the window of opportunity for ISET-PI to prove the relevance of its policy research, analysis and advice, and to provide timely advice to the government on crisis impact assessment, policies, and post-pandemic recovery plans.The global pandemic constrained many processes and changed the nature of business as usual. ISET moved to remote work from 16 March, 2019 and began gradually reopening its offices from 1 July 2020. Although COVID-19 constrained the implementation of some activities under the project, all key targeted activities and deliverables were efficiently completed. ISET-PI representatives joined the Prime Minister’s Advisory Group, and the institution ramped up itscommunication and public information activities through various media sources. Another challenge facing the institution is the highly competitive local and international environment for policy research and advice. Given such a climate, ISET-PI has been focusing on moving towards sustainability in a rigorous and ambitious manner.ISET PI developed Think-Tank Strategy and Communication Strategy that will be implemented in the coming year.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
